info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 4:23PM EDT until July 16 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Michigan, including the following county, Oakland.
* WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 420 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms over the past several hours. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain may result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Warren, Troy, Southfield, Pontiac, Sterling Heights, Royal Oak, Birmingham, Detroit Zoo, West Bloomfield, Farmington Hills, Rochester Hills, Madison Heights, Oak Park, Auburn Hills, Ferndale, Hazel Park, Berkley, Clawson, Farmington and Beverly Hills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING
